intro: Helena × tenuior, commonly known as the slender helena, is a hybrid plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves that give it a delicate appearance. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Helena × tenuior is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a ground cover.
